title: Kate Middleton channels Princess Diana as she takes traditional wardrobe for Pakistan trip

The Duchess of Cambridge knows the power of her clothes and uses her fashion choices wisely, getting it right pretty much all the time.

So royal watchers weren't at all surprised to see her pack a number of traditional outfits for her Royal Tour of Pakistan with husband Prince William.

Kate has looked stylist in a number of colourful outfits so far, including a turquoise trouser and dress set and a button coat.

Photos of her from the trip have echoed those taken of her late mother-in-law Diana, who wore similar outfits during her trips to the country in the 90s while dating surgeon Hasnat Khan.

He was concerned that her status and fame would make his life “hell” and told her the only way they would ever be able to be together and have a normal life was if they moved to Pakistan.

(Image: Ian Vogler / Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

During her visits she was spotted in a number of long tunic tops and scarves, and many of the photos have become some of the most iconic snaps of the late princess.

Fans took to social media to make comparisons between the two women.

One wrote: "Kate Middleton reminds of her mother in law Diana in blue Shalwar Kameez. Thanks for acknowledging our culture."

(Image: PA)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Another commented: "Lady Diana visited Pakistan in 1997 & she was painted in colour of Pakistan & today her daughter-in-law...Kate Middleton does the same."

A third said: "I'm loving Kate's wardrobe choices for her 5 day tour of Pakistan. She looked so elegant in a Catherine Walker aqua shalwar kameez... a fitting tribute to Diana. It's a traditional Pakistani flared kurti, with long shirt, and trousers."

As Kate stepped off the plane she wore a stunning bespoke turquoise Catherine Walker dress and trousers.

(Image: Ian Vogler / Daily Mirror)

(Image: PA)

Kate wore three outfits for the second day of the trip, starting with a royal blue kurta, a traditional long shift blouse, over a pair of trousers.

She teamed the colourful look with a pair of budget New Look low heels and earrings by Zeen.

For her visit to meet Prime Minister Kate changed into a green tunic by Catherine Walker over the top of cream trousers.

Princess Diana was very close friends with Khan’s ex-wife Jemima and her mother Annabel Goldsmith because a mother-life figure to her.

Then a famous cricketer, Khan reportedly told an 11-year-old William that he would be Pakistan’s Prime Minister one day, but he didn't believe him.
description: Kate Middleton is taking part in a five-day Royal Tour of Pakistan with husband Prince William, following in the footsteps of Princess Diana who regularly visited the country in the final years of her life
